intro: Acer linganense, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds called samaras. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
